snippet.title: Sonic: Fan Games/Hacks 558: Shadow Dream (SAGE2006)
snippet.description:
(These are my simple game play videos)
(I can and will remove specific videos if its necessary/requested)

Name: Shadow Dream - SAGE2006
Credit: FuntikX, Flonk
Release Date: June 24th, 2006 (August 24th, 2006)

My Website: https://scaleyfoxy.weebly.com/

Download: Only on Site.

(v0.4)
00:00 - Intro
00:51 - White Sky
01:32 - Cutscene
01:59 - Silent Forest
06:23 - Ending

(SAGE2006
06:58 - Title
07:38 - Cutscene 1
08:27 - White Sky
09:12 - Cutscene 2
09:44 - Silent Forest
12:04 - Cutscene 3
12:58 - Fatal Valley
16:25 - Credits

NOTES: So here is an old Ru fangame dating back to SAGE2006 and earlier.
Generally centered around Shadow as he finds himself floating in space and shortly falling without memory.
Surprising to nobody on that part aka the standard Shadow plot.
He then lands on a Foggy Planet surface and runs off to seek questions and answers.
All the while coming across his favorite toy of all time... "G.U.N" *cough* knowing military activities to be near this location
he speeds off only to fall into dream or a nightmare of some sort and his adventure ends there leaving us in the dark.

Now while the game does not reveal these plot points, Shadow is in an alternative world on the planet Colmulis as the only survivor.
Before potentially driven to insanity Mary "Roly" RolodNick the squirrel appears and together they adventure off as Shadow finds his answers.
At the end leaving to a severe plot point for us to decide their fate.
The villain of the plot being "Jarry Larson" Gloom the Hedgehog, the root cause of these nightmares and killings of everyone on the planet.
There is a ton of dark backstory written for the characters that i cannot cover here and couple of concept arts for em, sadly the game itself never really made it that far.

Overall while the gameplay may not be anything too crazy, it was clearly more story focus intended.
That and it initially gave me Silent Hill vibes "Not because of the obvious music choices"
But the full story sounds kinda interesting depending how it would of been executed.
